website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a target decoy, this buck with a replaceable insert gives you a good shot.
pros: comes with 2 stakes to make it sturdy
Works very well for archery practice
Holds up well in the weather
Target area can be removed and restored with a new foam, which extends the life
Does a good job of approximating the size of a real deer
cons: While this product is 3D and designed to look like a deer, it is not made with the compact and portable features of other deer decoys

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend as a birthday gift. He has been using it weekly for archery practice and it has held up very well. It is worth the investment. It is also well loved by the neighboring bucks. This target doesn’t hold up well when a lot of pressure is applied to it but thankfully it’s easy to assemble. Ten out of ten would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Tiah

customer_reviews.title: Spend $300 and get a target you can use!
customer_reviews.text: Received on Thursday, waited until Saturday to open for my son’s birthday, only to find that the ears were broken off. I wasn’t going to say anything to the seller. Today when we got a chance to set it up, the key ways that hold the legs on broke off. The first arrow that hits it will knock it over. I contacted the seller and was told I would have to box it up and return it for a refund. I asked if pictures would suffice and was told “no”. Item is too big and bulky for the hassle that would come with returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra $40 and get a good one.
customer_reviews.text: Reviews looked promising. However the Ears were broken off in the box. Legs are ridged plastic. Support stakes are pretty short. Not keeping damages goods. Am returning.
customer_reviews.author: troy kenworthy

customer_reviews.title: Quick ship, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Target arrived with ears broken off. Mounting pegs are tinny and target wobbles when hit. Seems very unstable and "posts" are all the way in the ground. Have only had the grandchildren shooting youth bows at 10-20 yds. but their arrows penetrate enough so that they need some effort to pull them out. Can't imagine how it react with a 60# compound at 20 yds. Overall seems very flimsy and poorly constructed compared to other Glen Del targets I've had in the past. Spend the money, get a good one. This is a waste. At least the kids can use it......
customer_reviews.author: Deweydf

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D target
customer_reviews.text: Great archery target. lots of fun,easy to put together but it my kids love it (and me ) just wish it was a little bigger but for the price it does great. only one thing is that I put adhesive where the legs go so they will stay together and on the horns so they will stay in the skull. been shooting it with my bow at #70 pounds and it holds up just fine but i would have given it 5 stars if it was bigger! for the price I love it
customer_reviews.author: Chadpoe

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: 90$ for something that arrives broke. The part you hook the leg to was broken so I had to lean it against my old target. Put three arrows in it and they're still there because you cant pull them out!
customer_reviews.author: Skins21

customer_reviews.title: Great target. Holds up to my crossbow that is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great target. Holds up to my crossbow that is 150lb draw back at 315fps. Using it to teach my daughter the right place to get a clean kill shot on a deer. Paper targets don't work as well compared to 3d ones.You can't beat the price and free shipping. We both love it. Besides a teaching tool its just fun to shoot at it. Put about 40 bolts threw it so far and haven't had to replace the center core so far. love this target.....
customer_reviews.author: Ratherbshooting

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Arrows are easy to remove. Stops my arrows thou they do stick out the other side and my broadheads are cutting up the backside a lot more then the front so no saving it for later but the core is only 30 bucks thou amazon doesn't carry it. Wouldn't buy again a little small for me. But good practice.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt A Carlsen

customer_reviews.title: Junk beware
customer_reviews.text: Looked like it had been shot by a couple hundred arrows already. Huge gashes and chunks taken out of the deer right out of the box. One of the metal stakes came stuck inside the legs and I cannot get the thing out. Core doesn’t fit the hole. Just expected a little more for $100 since its just foam basically. Please don’t waste your money, just spend a little more and get a real buck target.
customer_reviews.author: CDJ

customer_reviews.title: Great 3D Target for a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this target. It's not a 100% size deer, but I knew that going in. Putting it together was simple although I did, like other reviewers, need to trim off some molding flash before the target portion would fit correctly. Took all of 5 minutes with a sharp knife. I've now put about 250 arrows into the target and it shows no signs of degrading. Although you can't get replacement targets here on Amazon, you can get them from the manufacturer. All in all, the best value 3D target I've found.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Great product, arrived in great condition
customer_reviews.text: Product was in perfect condition when I received it, it is easy to put together, and performed appropriately when being shot at with arrows. This product seems to have received mixed reviews... My experience has been a very good one with this 3-D target. As stated above, the product was in excellent condition upon receiving and I have enjoyed using it. I’m a long time bow hunter and I do recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Missing ALL pieces
customer_reviews.text: This was all that was in the box!! A broken body with missing ears! No legs, no middle part, nothing! This is so expensive, and I was so excited. Returning ASAP and just going to make the drive to buy it from a store(few hours out) 🤦🏻‍♀️. I was really disappointed because I wanted to buy the whole animal set originally but glad I opted to try out just the deer first. This company clearly could care less of the quality they are shipping to their customers so I absolutely 100000% do not recommend. I wish I read the reviews Better before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Renna

customer_reviews.title: Very poor experience
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but seller only shipped it with the front leg. Buyer beware! This product is cheaply made and I recommend buying something a little sturdier. It has all of the features needed, but the quality is very poor. The foam crumbles easily and the item, in my experience, is not structurally sound to handle more than one orb2 arrows before it has to be propped back up or centered.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it’s cheap not worth your time or money
customer_reviews.text: Well it’s cheap just like the price. Just shot a few arrows into the target its falling apart. Honestly I rather buy another block than this target Don’t buy if you want something that falls apart in a few shots
customer_reviews.author: Awesome Sauce

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great deer target for backyard archery fun! Pretty sturdy once you find a good spot for him! Serves it's purpose well and seems durable!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley 1020

customer_reviews.title: don't wast your money
customer_reviews.text: this thing is junk at 30 yards my arrows go all the way up to the nock. what a wast of money and time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent target, not the best but not the worst.
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived with tears in the 'skin' covering of the deer. The legs are not as sturdy as I would have liked...they slide on.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn R.

customer_reviews.title: Broke before I was able to shoot one arrow
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, main body broke before I was able to shoot one arrow at it. I was installing the core of the target and it broke right above the back of the deer. Possibly able to still shoot the target and use it. Don’t buy this target. You get what you pay for. I’m going to buy better targets from now on. I haven’t contacted the company yet. Maybe they will help me out since the target is already broken. If they help me out I will change my review as far as customer service. But the quality of the actual product is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The target is okay. It is kind of thin in the legs are made out of hard plastic instead of the phone material so when an arrow hit it it actually broke the leg. I don't think we would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mom life!

customer_reviews.title: Great target. Very durable. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few years. My two sons love shooting at this and I have too. It has been very durable. Would recommend to others. It's about the size of a small doe, but it gives you something to shoot at from different angles to work on our accuracy and build confidence for hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Vanderplas

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Not with the money, does not hold up with light shooting. I shoot all field points and several hundred arrows a week at various targets. After approximately 200 it’s not stopping them very much. Not worth the money at all. I’m shooting 65 pound Hoyt RX1 and carbon Zombie slayer arrows. It may be fine for a lower poundage bow but I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 2 stars only because it arrived in tact.Never had a target made so cheap. Legs are plastic so if you make a low shot and hit the legs, they're gonna shatter. Leg mounts on body are weak too. Spend more money and buy a better target
customer_reviews.author: DeVet

customer_reviews.title: Easy arrow removal
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is... you get what you pay for. Easy arrow removal. Target is smallish. My daughter hit the legs with 1 arrow from a 24lb draw weight from 30 yards, and it shattered... praying no one else hits the legs or the target is done.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Would not suggest
customer_reviews.text: Came with a broke ear and already used. I am not even able to get a replacement, my only option is to get a refund or replace with other items(deer not included in list of replacement items.) Highly disappointed in the quality of this item.
customer_reviews.author: The reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Shipping Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: First received deer the ears were broken off, very flimsy if an arrow hits them they will come off. Bought second one because grandsons gift, ears intact but don't feel it is worth the money. Positive note, no issue yet with return will have to see how fast the refund is. Amazon shipping was fantastic, ordered the replacement at 2:00pm on Saturday received package 10:00am Sunday.
customer_reviews.author: William Smith

customer_reviews.title: maybe
customer_reviews.text: product came with a tear at the anchor point where leg slides to body making very unstable. even if there was no tear, and staked down properly, i kinda doubt it would stay up taking an arrow inside 40 yards.
customer_reviews.author: WHAT’S NEXT

customer_reviews.title: I found it almost impossible to remove the bolt from my crossbow.
customer_reviews.text: I could live with the size of the target and will use it as a decoy. I was set up to do some target shooting at 20 yds with my Barnett crossbow, a Quad Edge and shot the first bolt into the vitals. It penetrated almost all the way and was very hard to remove, the second one went into the vitals and came out the back about one half an inch. It was so hard to remove I tore my left rotary cuff and still did not get the bolt out. The target will now be used as a decoy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria M.

customer_reviews.title: dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: showed up, broken ears off just like the rest of the reviews on here. you would think they would have fixed that by now. thing is the size of a fawn on top of that. I would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Good target for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starting 3d target. It seems to hold up well enough but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: The target is working out pretty good but the legs are a week point. The back leg came damage right out of the box. But my kid and I have put alot of arrows through it. I'm sure it will only last a year or so
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Hard to put the target in not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Holly W.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap because you'll be buying another soon
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with broken ear. Antlers fall out of deer head at slightest disturbance. It feels like the dovetails which hold the legs onto the body are going to snap off when sliding the legs in. I would reccomend not buying this target. The low price lures you in, but avoid wasting your money.
customer_reviews.author: Cole and Cindy James

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve probably shot about 40 arrows in this target and the vital zone is already coming apart. My arrows blow junks of foam out the backside of the target and I’m using field points. It’s really about the size of a very small deer not what you’d see on a 120”+ deer. Overall I’d say don’t waste your money on this thing. Get a real 3D target!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get a cheap target for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Hard plastic legs. Not very durable. I guess you get what you pay for. Save your money and get a higher end target. Jmho
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but recieved damaged
customer_reviews.text: Good archery target i like it. It’s pretty easy to set up and it seems like it will last a while but I was pretty disappointed when i opened the box to find that it was broken. If it had not been broken i would give it 4.5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa S.

customer_reviews.title: Little over two months and about fifty arrows
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered on August 5th and my 13 year old son has put about 50 arrows in it. I feel like it should have held up better? It is now split in two.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The box showed up open. Took it out of the box and the plastic chipped off so bad it fell all over my floor, half the ear has already chipped off & more on the body. Really disappointed in this item.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: But it. Someone will shoot it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband, taken over by our adult sons. Full of holes. . . A win for me!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Evans

customer_reviews.title: Buck target
customer_reviews.text: Do not use it all the time. Shooting at the side of a deer instead of a regular target is a real eye opener! Adds that extra bit of realism that you need during final prep! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good target, just set it up next to something to make it more sturdy
customer_reviews.author: duhe winfrey

customer_reviews.title: great product. taken a lot of arrows and still ...
customer_reviews.text: great product. taken a lot of arrows and still looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Murray

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Although the price is cheaper than all of the other targets, it is not worth the price. The entire body has air pockets all over it as well as the insert. The insert also doesn't fit entirely into the slot and sticks out the one side. Would not recommend buying this. Would have been worth my money to pay the extra $20 to get something of a higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Decent 3D buck
customer_reviews.text: Decent back yard target no important complaints. Do wish it was all solid foam. Legs are hard plastic
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. I’ve shot about 200 shots into with field points and it looks like it’s going to last a long time. Easy to pull also. When it does fall apart I can just order a replacement core. Update: Less than 2 months and the target has fallen apart. Junk Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rabjohn

customer_reviews.title: Looked awful when delivered
customer_reviews.text: The box was completely crushed and torn up upon delivery. Part of the target itself was crushed where you slide the leg on so the leg isn't very stable. Not a great product but it is for my 7 yr old so it's ok for him. Would not suggest for serious shooting. Completely disappointed with the way it arrived and the quality.
customer_reviews.author: wendy merriman

customer_reviews.title: Did not come with the high density replaceable core like the description says.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely useless without the high density replaceable core. NOT HAPPY AT ALL TO BE LIED to on your product description. My son spent his hard earned money on his own to purchase this only to find out there was no core. He reached out directly to the sellers and they rejected his ticket. RIPOFF!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Lowe

customer_reviews.title: MISSING EARS
customer_reviews.text: So I knew buying a cheaper model of a 3D target would have it flaws but didnt realize i wouldn't have ears lol. I would I could walk up on a buck like this in nature would be one of the easiest kills ever. He wouldn't hear me coming 🤣. I mean I spent the money on it atleast give me everything that is in the picture on the ad.
customer_reviews.author: Brent W.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. The legs broke off before we even got a chance to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica W

customer_reviews.title: Tough little target
customer_reviews.text: Put it at twenty yards away from my porch and in between two apple trees. At night a buck attacked him and he was in pieces and I put him back together and nothing wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Passen

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: No nose. It came off in shipping and got crushed. Not thrilled but it’ll work. And no stakes to go in ground
customer_reviews.author: D French

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive target
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fine product for a target buck for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Superior

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product, for what you pay. It beats buying a cheap target and shooting through it in 12 shots. The center piece doesn’t fit all the way in so that’s why I gave it 4 stars. I will probably buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: ... our son who is growing to be an outdoorsman like his dad
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our son who is growing to be an outdoorsman like his dad. They both used the target and it’s worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Broken ears
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed a little. The ears were broken when I received it. It was bought as a Christmas present and it was broken. Otherwise seems to be ok. I like that you can replace the target area. We will see how well it stands up to Target practice.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: These things are junk. Don't waste your money! Bought it and broke upon delivery. Called company and received a second one and it was broke same place.
customer_reviews.author: Unhappy customer

customer_reviews.title: Good item Recieved broken
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box to put it together and saw the ear was broke off from the buck. A little boy was sad his item showed up broken
customer_reviews.author: Alysha

customer_reviews.title: Value for the price
customer_reviews.text: A great value for the money... Not the best 3-D target but it's worth What I paid for it...
customer_reviews.author: Krisoffer Modlin

customer_reviews.title: This thing is junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, poor fit, pieces don’t fit together well. I’ve shot this thing maybe 3 dozen times and it’s falling apart. Leg keys are sloppy, insert doesn’t fit properly, bolts are hard to remove. Spend a little more and get something of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Buck

customer_reviews.title: we've had our target for two months and had a ...
customer_reviews.text: we've had our target for two months and had a blast shooting in between rain. seems to be holding up very well with all the rainy Oregon weather.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much the worst target I’ve ever bought. 50 lb bow at 60 yards blows through the target the foam blew out in fist sized chunks where hit target it virtually destroyed after 10 arrows
customer_reviews.author: joseph grimm

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Will do its job but has some flaws. There's a small crack in the foam on the edge of where the insert goes in and the paint on the ears is peeling off. Some air pockets throughout the body as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 8 shots
customer_reviews.text: While it was lightweight and great size, the foam piece which slides into the leg broke off after the target was hit after exactly 8 arrows. Will be doing return/reimbursement/replacement. Otherwise good product.
customer_reviews.author: Lartus

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: Not a good target my arrows pas through very easy at 30 yds
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Field Logic 3-D Target
customer_reviews.text: Good value.Fun to shoot; arrows easily removed. However, the vital insert did not fit quite right-- it was too big to fit into the slot all the way. I had to cut part of the piece to make it fit. Not a big deal, but I should not have had to this. Still a good target at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Les S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect item, Great Price and arrived in quick time! Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! Target is great and price is right
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! Target is great and price is right. Several shots and it still looks good. My brother-in-law did hit one of the legs and it cracked but is still holding up good. If anything a little duct tape can fix it.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am giving this such a low rating is because the quality is TERRIBLE, the only foam part of the deer is the insert, which in itself i could not get to set fully in the body cavity. The foam itself is cheap and almost as hard as the plastic that the body is made of. Didnt even bother to shoot an arrow in to it. Sent back and will be paying a bit more for something that will last! looking for something cheap for youth then this would work, only reason it got more than a single star. For any advanced bow shooters or avid hunters, look else where.
customer_reviews.author: jeffery daniels

customer_reviews.title: Field Logic Shooter Buck 3D Archery Target 71600
customer_reviews.text: This is nice, fairly life-sized deer target. It stood up well while taking shots, and has lasted through a lot of practice. Replacement inserts are available.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tomp

customer_reviews.title: Good target for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good target for the price, but I suggest spending a little more if you have it though. The arrow pass through blows chunks out of the exit hole. I shoot a 70lb bow with field tips to, not even broad heads and this happens. But its a lot more fun shooting a deer then a block. I'm enjoying practicing quartering away shots now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My Son in Law uses it all the time for bow practice
customer_reviews.author: lsc

customer_reviews.title: Missing "vital" item...no target section.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe this is just an anomaly, but my buck shipped without the target insert section. Can't write a proper review until I can actually shoot at the target.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good target, holds up well so far to field ...
customer_reviews.text: Good target , holds up well so far to field points and broadheads. only issue is with the center not fitting properly.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Saved Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I had bought another on of these some where else on line. It was a site to store place and I waited until the day I was suppose to pick it up and then I looked they had canceled my order and didn't tell me. I went right over to my Amazon page and looked it up and saw this deer target big than the other one at a cheaper price. I got it in two days after placing the order. My son was so happy when he opened it Christmas day and has not stopped shooting at it yet. Thank You Amazon for saving Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Brownfield

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great target nicely made easy to set up and practice with
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I shoot a traditional longbow that's 55# @ 28" for draw weight. This target seems to be holding up well so far with over 100 arrows put to it. The legs aren't falling off and the arrows pull out easy enough. The insert stays put too. It is small but it serves the purpose. If you do have an issue with the legs popping off you can use a little construction grade glue to permanently adhere them. I would recommend filling the legs with insulating foam so if you do wound the target in the leg - the leg won't become weak and buckle. They're only hollow plastic.
customer_reviews.author: R Vez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I shoot this target a lot and it's still alive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ok falls apart, i had to glue all seams ...
customer_reviews.text: ok falls apart,i had to glue all seams,will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: frank mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Not packaged well or this was a return nose was broke off when we got it
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty good after we reinforced the stakes very flimsy nose was broke off when we got it was a christmas present so we did not return grandson was excited
customer_reviews.author: Paul N.

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was great. Product fell apart within a week
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was great. Product fell apart within a week. Would not recommend the product. Did not ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Great Target, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in great shape, no broken ears as others had noted, but with the way it was packaged i can easily see how they would break off. The legs are made of plastic, and an inexperienced shooter may easily break a leg if they were to miss the target. Easy to move and steak in the ground. My dog tries to play with it as if it were a real animal.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.

customer_reviews.title: target practice
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift for my grandson and he was thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: CONSUMER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would highly recommend buying this product. Just as shown, fast shipping and great service.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: ... gift for my husband and he seems to really like it. Its holding up a lot better than ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my husband and he seems to really like it. Its holding up a lot better than I expected it too. One friend of his did hit the legs which is just hard plastic and it tore more when they pulled it out. Hes still standing though
customer_reviews.author: Kwj

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to put together and also very light so you will be able to move it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Horton

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than description-arrows almost ran through decoy and kept going
customer_reviews.author: Rae Ann Mason

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Good target for the price. Wish it was a little more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: ... that lasts a couple years for an occasional shooter like me. I only draw 45 lbs
customer_reviews.text: Cheap little target that lasts a couple years for an occasional shooter like me. I only draw 45 lbs. I think a heavy shooter might blow right through it
customer_reviews.author: MGH of Kodiak

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very decent for the price worked as expected and held up ok
customer_reviews.author: Brayden

customer_reviews.title: Broken ears
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other reviews.. It came with the ears broken off. Just going to superglue them back on as it isnt the biggest deal.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing
customer_reviews.text: No antlers was in box, so I guess mine is a shooter doe ??
customer_reviews.author: Greg R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: much smaller than expected. very difficult to pull arrows out of core
customer_reviews.author: Harper Ross

customer_reviews.title: OK value
customer_reviews.text: I've got this on a stand, so it is ok for sturdiness, not great. It serves it's purpose in stopping arrows.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hermsen

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This target is extremely lightweight. Does not seem very durable, but for the price I should have expected it. We'll see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ames

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: The ears came broken off my I just got some tooth pics and put it back on ain’t no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas opal

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, shipped and received fast. Crossbow bolts ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, shipped and received fast. Crossbow bolts are a little difficult to remove, but they do not pass through. Works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's a good target.
customer_reviews.text: We've kind of killed the center, we'll have to replace it soon but this dear target had saved me so much money. instead of the husband going to the range all the time he uses this and has saved us a few Benjamen :)
customer_reviews.author: Clair

customer_reviews.title: For the price it serves well for good hunting practice shot placement
customer_reviews.text: Do not keep in the sun. It does not do well. For the price it serves well for good hunting practice shot placement. No 3D score rings if that’s what you are searching for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Molting after one day
customer_reviews.text: In the sun for one day and its falling apart. Not happy at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t come with everything
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with stakes. I had to purchase a stand for it separately which just added to the total investment.
customer_reviews.author: Dtindall

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Great deal. My niece loved it. Was delivered 24hrs after I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: dawn morehouse

product_meta.title: Shooter Buck 3D Deer Archery Target with Replaceable Core
product_meta.description: Shooter Buck is a great alternative to high priced 3-D targets for the casual or serious hunter, offers large size and replaceable insert to realistic practice and long target life, easy arrow.
feature_bullets: LIFE-LIKE SHOOTER BUCK - The biggest toughest 3D Target in the Universe, This Life-like Buck stands 48" Tall, 125" P & Y Antlers

BANG FOR YOUR BUCK - Includes a replaceable high density core insert that offers up to 5 times the shooting surface of other 3D Targets. The shooting insert extends the life of your target (Additional Inserts: Order GlenDel Model #G71630)
STABILITY - the crossbow Shooter stands at 4 feet tall but it will never waver because ground stakes are included
IMPENETRABLE - Stops ALL Broadhead and Field Tip Arrows
MADE IN THE USA - at Shooter, we are proud that all of 3D targets are made right here in the USA

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
